oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Sunday Down South - 1949-07-31 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WSM program Sunday Down South, sponsored by Lion Oil. Originally broadcast 1949-07-31 (unconfirmed), part 2. Personnel include Louie Buck (host), Ott Devine (announcer), Beasley Smith (conductor) and the Lion Orchestra (performer), Snooky Lanson (performer), Dottie Dillard (performer), the Old Hickory Singers (performers), and Charlie Ackerson (performer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Snooky Lanson; Dottie Dillard; Charlie Ackerson; Beasley Smith; Lion Orchestra
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Louie Buck and Snooky Lanson talk [continued from part 1] -- Once And For Always (Snooky Lanson) -- Louie Buck introduces Dottie Dillard -- The Surrey With The Fringe On Top (Dottie Dillard) -- Lion Oil commercial (Ott Devine) -- Louie Buck introduces Charlie Ackerson -- Hello! Ma Baby (Charlie Ackerson) -- Louie Buck thanks Charlie Ackerson -- Dream (excerpt) (Snooky Lanson, Dottie Dillard) -- Snooky Lanson and Dottie Dillard talk about Irving Berlin and Ethel Merman -- I Got The Sun In The Mornin' (And The Moon At Night) (excerpt) (Dottie Dillard) -- Snooky Lanson talks -- They Say It's Wonderful (excerpt) (Snooky Lanson) -- Dottie Dillard talks -- Doin' What Comes Natur'lly (excerpt) (Dottie Dillard) -- Snooky Lanson talks -- The Girl That I Marry (Snooky Lanson) -- Theme (Beasley Smith and the Lion Orchestra) -- Closing statement (Louie Buck) -- Lion Oil commercial (Ott Devine)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Sunday down south (Radio program); Devine, Ott, 1910-1994; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Lanson, Snooky; Dillard, Dottie; Old Hickory Singers; Ackerson, Charlie
